result.execSummary:
The defendant Dawn R Sindowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Time served with 2 days of sentence credit

9:18 AM Defendant Dawn R Sindowski in court, in custody at the Columbia County jail.  Attorney Claire M Edwards in court for Dawn R Sindowski.  Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/ Elements. Defendant pleads guilty to sole count. Court finds defendant guilty. Judgment to be entered. Court sentences defendant to 2 days jail, time served with 2 days sentence credit, $443.00 costs/ fees due in 60 days or with a payment plan, DNA sample. 9:24 AM
